name: Chicken and Black Bean Chimichangas
author: 14 Hands Winery
summary: While traditional chimichangas are deep-fried, this version pan-fries them instead for a friendlier take on the classic. Feel free to add sour cream and guacamole, and don't forget a glass of 14 Hands Hot to Trot!
directions: Heat a large saucepan over medium heat
Pour in oil and add the onion and garlic
Saute until they just start to become translucent, about 5 minutes
Add in the oregano, cumin, and chili powder and cook for 1 minute longer
Mix in the black beans, chicken, and salsa
Bring to a boil and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes
Remove from heat and stir in Cheddar, green onions, cilantro, and salt
Using a warm oven or a hot burner, warm the tortillas until they become soft and pliable
Lay out the softened tortillas on a work surface and divide the filling between the tortillas
Fold the sides of each tortilla in toward the middle; roll up like a burrito
Heat remaining oil in a saute pan over medium heat
When the oil is hot, work in batches and brown each chimichanga on all sides
Transfer chimichangas to a baking pan; place in the oven and bake until heated through, about 15 minutes
